intro: Harina rumphii, commonly known as the Malayan orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
